snippet: The Ohio Court of Appeals ordered a new trial over a claim that commercial truck dealers were overcharged by the company for more than a decade.
abstract: Ohio Court of Appeals overturns 2011 ruling ordering the Ford Motor Company to pay $2 billion to commercial truck dealers who claim they were overcharged by the company for more than a decade.
lead_paragraph: The Ohio Court of Appeals ordered a new trial over a claim that commercial truck dealers were overcharged by the company for more than a decade.

headline.main: Court Reverses $2 Billion Ruling Against Ford and Orders a New Trial
headline.print_headline: Court Reverses $2 Billion Ruling Against Ford and Orders a New Trial
